meanings.definition: Done by one person, group, or country without the agreement of others.
meanings.sent1: The decision to close the office was made unilaterally by the manager.
meanings.sent2: The president's unilaterally imposed tariffs caused tension with other nations.
meanings.sent3: It was quite unilaterally decided that pizza would be the only food at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her unilaterally chosen outfit stood out among the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's unilaterally strict rules made the students uneasy.

meanings.definition: Affecting, representing, or performed by only one side.
meanings.sent1: The unilaterally painted wall brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The unilaterally signed contract favored the seller over the buyer.
meanings.sent3: The unilaterally decorated cake looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His unilaterally chosen path led him to unexpected adventures.
meanings.sent5: The unilaterally drawn line divided the playground in half.
